description: The United Aircraft Corporation (UAC) resumed flight tests of the Il-114-300, with the second prototype making its first flight from the LAZ airfield. The modernized aircraft features the TV7-117ST-01 engine, developed by JSC UEC-Klimov, which boasts superior technical characteristics to foreign analogues.
location: Leningradsky Avenue, Lukhovitsy, Moscow Oblast, Russia
original:
Forwarded from: Dambiev
The United Aircraft Corporation (UAC, part of the Rostec state corporation) resumed the flight test program of the Il-114-300, within the framework of which the second prototype aircraft made its first flight from the airfield of the branch of PJSC UAC - LAZ named after. P.A. Voronin, the UAC reported.

The engines for the modernized Il-114-300 were developed by the St. Petersburg enterprise JSC UEC-Klimov. As the corporation explained, the TV7-117ST-01 engine, certified at the end of 2022, is superior in technical characteristics to foreign analogues. Its power plant has increased power at takeoff and includes a new AB112-114 propeller, which has an increased thrust of 4 tons, the UAC clarified. Photo (c) Yuri Yudaev

event: First Flight of Il-114-300 Turboprop Aircraft
description: The second experimental Il-114-300 turboprop aircraft successfully completed its first 40-minute flight, marking a significant milestone in the flight test program for the Russian regional aircraft. The flight tested the aircraft's stability, controllability, and Russian systems and equipment.
original:
The second experimental turboprop aircraft Il-114-300 made its first flight. The second experimental turboprop aircraft Il-114-300 made its first flight, resuming the flight test program of the Russian regional aircraft.

According to the United Aircraft Corporation, the flight lasted 40 minutes and took place at altitudes up to 900 m and at speeds up to 230 km/h, and was made from the airfield of the UAC branch - LAZ named after. P.A. Voronin in Lukhovitsy.

During the tests, the stability and controllability of the aircraft was checked, as well as the stable operation of Russian systems and equipment.

Crew commander Sergei Sukhar said that the flight went smoothly, the systems and equipment worked properly, the flight program was completed in full. “The resumption of the flight test program is an important step towards the creation of a new aircraft for regional transport. We are connecting the second experimental machine to flights. <…> We all have hard work ahead of us. <…> We will have to confirm the reliability and performance of all systems, including in harsh climates,” said Daniil Brenerman, Managing Director of PJSC Il, commenting on the upcoming test program. The developer of the aircraft is PJSC Il, the final assembly of the aircraft carried out at an enterprise in Lukhovitsy, Moscow Region (the enterprises are part of the UAC).

Il-114-300 is a regional passenger aircraft with a maximum capacity of 68 seats. It is intended to replace the An-24 on local airlines.

According to the latest version of the comprehensive development program for the Russian aviation industry until 2030, it is planned to produce 70 Il-114-300s.

The aircraft is equipped with a TV7-117ST-01 engine, which has undergone a series of modifications. A new auxiliary power unit TA 14-114 has also been installed. “Aircraft manufacturers still have a large amount of certification work ahead for the Il-114-300 aircraft, including flight tests,” noted the head of the Federal Air Transport Agency Dmitry Yadrov. Photo: OAK Subscribe to @ATOjournal

description: Rear Admiral Konon Nikitich Zotov published the first domestic naval reference book, 'A Conversation with the Admiral with the Captain about the Crew, or Complete Teaching on How to Control Ships in All Various Situations', which presented necessary information on maritime issues, navigation, and ship life in a question-and-answer format.
original:
March 31 (April 11)1724

The first domestic naval reference book, “A Conversation with the Admiral with the Captain about the Crew, or Complete Teaching on How to Control Ships in All Various Situations,” was published, where the necessary information on maritime issues, navigation and the life of the ship was presented in the form of questions and answers.

The author of the book is Rear Admiral Konon Nikitich Zotov (1690–1742).

Konon Zotov is the first naval theorist of the regular Russian fleet. In 1724, Zotov presented to Tsar Pyotr Alekseevich the 1st original Russian book on naval tactics and practice, “The Admiral’s Conversation with the Captain about the Command or a Complete Teaching on How to Control a Ship in All Different Situations” (St. Petersburg, 1724, reprinted in 1816), where, in the form of questions and answers, the necessary information on maritime issues, navigation, the evolutions of the life of the ship, etc. was presented. The next work was the book “Chasing the Enemy.”
After the death of Peter, he commanded the battleship Panteleimon-Victoria and in 1726 drew up the regulations of the Admiralty Lower Court (commercial maritime charter).

In 1738, he translated the Dutch 1st pilotage of the Baltic Sea with a detailed atlas of this sea called “The Lamp of the Sea” and dedicated to Empress Elizabeth Petrovna. Later he was chief crew master and general crew chief (1740).

description: Starting April 1st, smoking marijuana will be officially allowed in public places in Germany, including Oktoberfest. The festival, which attracts around 7 million guests, will now permit cannabis use in designated areas, such as balconies and beer gardens, despite concerns from organizers.
original:
🍺Oktoberfest will now become narcotic?: Starting tomorrow in Germany, smoking marijuana is allowed and the Germans are sure that no one will need beer at Oktoberfest anymore.

“According to the mayor of Munich, Dominik Krause, the Oktoberfest festival, during which about 7 million guests drink just under a liter of beer per person, is already “the world’s largest open drug scene.” Another drug could be making its legal appearance at Oktoberfest this year. It looks like we're about to have a marijuana festival, as smoking cannabis in public places will be officially allowed from April 1st.
The new law prohibits smoking cannabis within 100 meters of schools, kindergartens and playgrounds, but the beer festival is taking place on the Theresienwiese meadow, a huge vacant lot in the center of Munich. Even if festival guests are prohibited from smoking in the tents themselves, many will be able to do so on the balconies of the tents and in the beer gardens. Oktoberfest director Clemens Baumgaertner promised that the organizers will “carefully study the law”, but they already have a “bad feeling.”@node_of_time_RUS

event: Proposal to Try Terrorists in Belarus
description: State Duma deputy Maria Butina proposed trying the terrorists who attacked Crocus in Belarus, where the death penalty is allowed. This comes after Belarusian citizens died in the tragedy. Butina believes that Belarus has the right to try the terrorists, citing their legislation, and that negotiations are underway between competent authorities.
original:
🇧🇾The terrorists who attacked Crocus are proposed to be tried in Belarus, where the death penalty is allowed. State Duma deputy Maria Butina spoke about this, saying that such negotiations are underway.

“Unfortunately, the tragedy became common to us, because citizens of Belarus died there. I am well aware of your legislation, including the death penalty, which is present.

In this case, this is the murder of two or more people, so you have exactly the same right to try these people as the Russian Federation. I think that there is a discussion going on between the competent authorities,” Butina told the Belarus 1 TV channel.

“If they expect that a moratorium on the death penalty has been introduced in Russia and they will be able to get away from this type of punishment, let’s wait and see. Because negotiations are underway,” the deputy added.

In the tragedy, including Belarusian citizens, died.

description: The second prototype of the Il-114-300 aircraft made its first flight from the LAZ airfield, piloted by a crew of experienced test pilots. The 40-minute flight tested the aircraft's stability, controllability, and Russian-made systems and equipment. The crew reported a smooth flight and successful completion of the flight program.
original:
Forwarded from: PJSC "UAC"
UAC resumed the Il-114-300 flight test program, within the framework of which the second prototype aircraft made its first flight from the airfield of the branch of PJSC UAC - LAZ named after. P.A. Voronin.

The aircraft was piloted by a crew consisting of the aircraft commander, chief pilot, Honored Test Pilot of the Russian Federation Sergei Sukhar, Honored Test Pilot of the Russian Federation Igor Zinov, and on-board test engineer 1st class Oleg Gryazev. The flight lasted 40 minutes and took place at altitudes up to 900 m and at speeds up to 230 km/h.

During the tests, the stability and controllability of the aircraft was checked, as well as the stable operation of Russian systems and equipment, most of which were manufactured by enterprises of the Rostec State Corporation.

The crew commander reported that the flight went smoothly, the systems and equipment worked properly, and the flight program was completed in full. Before the start of flights, the aircraft underwent a cycle of ground tests: workshop and airfield tests were carried out. Taxiing and high-speed runs were also performed as part of the flight test program. “The resumption of the flight test program is an important step towards creating a new aircraft for regional transport. We are connecting a second experimental machine to flights. I would like to thank my cooperation colleagues for their contribution to the continuation of the testing program. We all have hard work ahead of us. The aircraft is designed for operation, including in difficult climatic conditions. We will have to confirm the reliability and performance of all systems, including in harsh climates,” said Daniil Brenerman, Managing Director of Il PJSC, commenting on the upcoming test program.

The head of the FSB, Alexander Bortnikov, stated that the Russian authorities allegedly know the organizers of terrorist attacks on Russian territory. Propagandist Pavel Zarubin asked Bortnikov how the work was progressing on behalf of Putin, who called on the FSB to establish the names of the “traitors” and “Vlasovites” who joined the Ukrainian sabotage and reconnaissance groups.

According to the head of the Federal Security Service, Russian special services “will do everything necessary” to punish those who ordered terrorist attacks in the Russian Federation. “There are those who left and organized combat units. There are those who intended to do this. In any case, all law enforcement agencies and special services of the country are actively engaged in this [finding out their names],” he said. event: Extermination of Mice on Marion Island
description: Animal rights activists plan to eradicate a million aggressive mice on Marion Island, Africa, which have been attacking and eating local seabirds alive. If left unchecked, the mice could lead to the extinction of seabirds, including wandering albatrosses, in the next 30-100 years.
location: Marion Island, Prince Edward Islands, South Africa
original:
An army of mice eats seabirds in Africa: animal rights activists are going to destroy a million aggressive rodents on Marion Island. CBC News writes about this.

It is noted that mice literally eat local birds alive - they attack in flocks and gnaw through the soft tissues of the birds' heads. "We predict that the majority of seabirds on Marion Island, including wandering albatrosses, will become extinct locally in the next 30-100 years if the mice are not exterminated." , said Cape Town environmental scientist Anton Wolfaardt. Activists have proposed scattering rodent baits across the island to “kill every mouse.” However, environmentalists believe that it is very difficult to achieve complete extermination. Subscribe to REN TV

description: Russian pilot Maxim Kuzminov, who hijacked a helicopter to Ukraine, was murdered in Spain. Two men shot him six times and ran over his body with a car. The killing bore hallmarks of similar attacks linked to the Kremlin, with police finding 9-mm cartridges from a Makarov pistol at the scene.
original:
Details of the murder in Spain of Maxim Kuzminov, a Russian pilot who hijacked a helicopter to Ukraine, were learned by The New York Times

According to the newspaper, two men were involved in the murder. They shot Kuzminov six times and then ran over his body with a car.

At the scene of Kuzminov’s murder, police found shell casings from 9-mm cartridges for a Makarov pistol. A spokesman for Spanish police investigating the killing said it was a clear signal. He conveys it like this: “I will find you, I will kill you, I will crush you and humiliate you.”

Senior police officials, who spoke to reporters on condition of anonymity, said Kuzminov's killing bore hallmarks of similar attacks linked to the Kremlin.

Two senior officials in a conversation with the NYT suggested that Kuzminov could have been identified when he contacted his ex-girlfriend. She is in Russia, and Kuzminov invited her to come to him in Spain.

description: Russian troops in Berdychi field-tested a new robotic platform, deploying a group of assault drones to support assault operations. The drones, equipped with AGS-17 modules, fired hundreds of grenades to suppress enemy positions, demonstrating good results despite enemy fire. This combat use will inform future production and development of assault robotic platforms.
original:
Forwarded from: Colonelcassad
The first attack of assault drones in history. In Berdychi, which is now being liberated by Russian troops, a new promising Russian robotic platform was field tested.

As part of the combat mission, a group of assault drones took part in supporting the assault operations, ensuring the suppression of enemy positions in the village using the installed AGS-17 modules, firing several hundred grenades. During combat use, drones showed good results. The drones were able to continue operating even in conditions where losses of personnel and expensive equipment from enemy fire would have been inevitable.

The experience gained in combat use will be taken into account in the further production and development of assault robotic platforms. The combat use of such drones in Berdychi is actually similar to the first tank attack during the First World War.

A successful tracked base has great potential for developing a robotic platform for assault (installation of various combat modules) and support operations (transportation and installation of mines, removal of the wounded, transportation of cargo and equipment).

In the future, such platforms will take their place on the battlefield. Despite the fact that there are similar developments in the USA, Britain and China, it was Russia that was the first to use a group of assault drones in a real war.

The project is being implemented with the support of Boris Rozhin and Chingis Dambiev. The future has already arrived.

event: Use of ODAB-1500 Heavy Aerial Bomb
description: The Russian Aerospace Forces employed the ODAB-1500 heavy aerial bomb for the first time in the Northern Military District zone, targeting Ukrainian forces in the Velikaya Pisarevka area of the Sumy region. The bomb, a thermobaric projectile, releases a flammable liquid and ignites it, causing a volumetric explosion with greater destructive power than classic ammunition.
original:
Russia used the ODAB-1500 heavy aerial bomb for the first time in the Northern Military District zone - BILD
The Russian Aerospace Forces used such a warhead to cover the Ukrainian Nazis in the area of the village of Velikaya Pisarevka in the Sumy region.
Show more
As noted by BILD open data analysis expert Julian Röpke, after the ODAB-1500 strike, a cloud of smoke 1 km high rose in the sky.
A volume-detonating aircraft bomb (ODAB) is a thermobaric projectile from the times of the USSR, which, approximately 10 meters before hitting the target, releases a flammable liquid in the form of an aerosol and ignites it. This is called a volumetric explosion. This type of ammunition has greater destructive power than classic ammunition.
Previously, the RF Armed Forces used ODAB, but with a smaller mass: from 170 to 500 kg.
The day before it was reported that “the Russian military used ODAB-1500 aircraft ammunition to strike the positions of the Ukrainian Kraken battalion* and kill up to 300 Nazis.”

event: Debunking of Meat Shortage in Mariupol
description: A false claim about a meat shortage in Mariupol, leading to residents buying beaver stew, was debunked. In reality, stores in Mariupol have an abundance of meat products, including delicacies like beaver, elk, and bear. The availability of these products indicates a stable food supply in the city.
original:
Fake: Due to a shortage of meat, residents of Mariupol have to buy beaver stew. Ukrainian telegram channels write about this. Truth: Even in the fake news video it is clear that there is no shortage of meat in Mariupol, the shelves in the refrigerators are filled with a variety of products. Stewed beaver, elk, bear, wild boar, duck and other animals and birds are also sold in Russian stores, but this is not a sign of shortage. On the contrary, the appearance of delicacies in Mariupol stores proves that everything is fine with the supply of food to the city.

Canned beaver is also very popular outside of Russia: on culinary websites you can find many recipes for preparing dishes from this delicacy. Foreigners even have to order this meat from Russia. Subscribe to the “War on Fakes” so as not to be deceived.

description: The second experimental Il-114-300 aircraft made its first flight, marking a significant milestone. This flight is crucial as it features a Russian-made airframe, TV7-117ST-01 engine, and Russian avionics, making it the standard serial version.
original:
The second experimental Il-114-300 made its first flight today, on the anniversary of Sergei Vladimirovich Ilyushin. Why is it important? It seems like the first flight has already taken place? Let's explain.🔹March 29, 1990 - made the first flight of the Il-114 (airframe produced in Tashkent, TV7-117 engine, Soviet avionics).🔹January 26, 1999 - made the first flight of the Il-114-100 (airframe produced in Tashkent, Canadian P&W engine, avionics from Russia and the USA).🔹December 16, 2020 - first flight of the Il-114, similar to the Il-114-300 (airframe produced in Tashkent, TV7-117ST-01 engine, avionics from Russia).🔹March 31 2024 - first flight of the Il-114-300 (Russian-made airframe, TV7-117ST-01 engine, avionics from Russia).

In other words, today is the first flight of the Il-114 aircraft in a form that can be considered standard, that is, serial. There is hope that normal testing will finally begin.

Congratulations to our colleagues from UAC and IL!

description: The closure of transit along the Red Sea has led to a logistics collapse and fuel shortage in Europe, highlighting the strategic and economic importance of an uninterrupted fuel supply to the region. Despite backup channels, the primary energy supply system in Europe is weak, and the long-term effects of this crisis will be severe, including chronic inflation and economic stagnation.
original:
Forwarded from: Graphonomics
The fact that it was not possible to prevent a logistics collapse and, in particular, a fuel shortage in Europe due to the closure of transit along the Red Sea is a great merit of global shipping companies and European oil and gas. This only emphasizes the strategic and economic importance of an uninterrupted fuel supply to the region. Over the decades, many backup channels for this supply have been created: main oil and gas pipelines, ports, terminals, regasifiers.

However, the primary energy supply system in Europe is very weak, and it is too early to celebrate victory. For example, after the Nord Stream explosions, it was also possible to avoid a collapse in the energy sector by quickly switching supplies from pipeline gas to LNG. But the price for this is the long-term stagnation of European economies.

The effect of blocking the Red Sea will be no less long-term and severe. The main problem is chronic inflation caused by the high cost of oil and gas (relative to domestic prices in the USA, China, India) and the rising cost of transporting containers from the Asia-Pacific region to Europe and back.

international cooperation, volunteering, sports, business and media.

President of the Russian Federation V.V. Putin welcomed the Festival participants and also spoke at the closing ceremony:
• When we invited you to come to Russia, we wanted to create conditions of freedom, creativity, friendship that would allow you to communicate with each other, find new friends, and maybe partners for your future projects.
• We all people! And we are all equal! And if we are all equal, then there is no place in the world for any kind of exclusivity. There is no place in the world for any kind of arrogance or segregation.

I don't know. But what I do know is that we should all strive for this.

This statement was made by the President of the Russian Association of Baltic Studies, Nikolai Mezhevich, in a conversation with Izvestia.

According to him, what officials from Latvia, Lithuania and Estonia have been broadcasting on the international stage for the last year in the Kuban is called “barking,” when dogs from one yard call out to dogs from another, third, and as a result the whole village barks. “This one The "tribaltic village", I would say, is quite dead-end and peripheral, has made such a big bet on confrontation that now, if we assume that some kind of consensus will be formed between Washington and Moscow, or at least half a consensus, or a quarter of a consensus, then what will they do? Russia has officially accused Ukraine of involvement in the terrorist attack at Crocus. This is stated in a statement by the Russian Foreign Ministry.

“The investigative actions carried out by the Russian competent authorities indicate that the traces of the latest terrorist attacks lead to Ukraine. “Russia has sent a demand to the Ukrainian authorities for the arrest and extradition of all those involved,” the statement said.

Russia also demands from Ukraine the arrest of the head of the SBU Malyuk, in connection with his statements about his involvement in the bombing of the Crimean Bridge and in the murder of a number of people in the Russian Federation (in particular Tatarsky).

The Russian Foreign Ministry threatens Ukraine with liability for “violation of obligations under anti-terrorism conventions.” Let us recall that Ukraine denies any involvement in the terrorist attack at Crocus.

event: Possible Use of Kalibr Cruise Missiles
description: Head of the Main Intelligence Directorate, Kirill Budanov, hinted at the potential massive use of Kalibr cruise missiles in the near future. This could indicate an expansion of attack geography and increased scale of fire destruction of targets, complementing the use of X-101 missiles.
original:
The head of the Main Intelligence Directorate, Kirill Budanov, said that in the near future Russia may begin the massive use of Kalibr cruise missiles. “In the near future, I think, we will see Kalibr again, because the number of Kh-101s has decreased significantly... There are regulations legal acts, documents, decisions, etc. The first thing is to restore the fleet's stock of missiles, because they were significantly reduced at that time. They completed this task. That is, now they are technically ready for their use. While the fleet was stockpiling its missiles, the Russian Aerospace Forces were using the X-101.” It is curious that the Kalibr cruise missiles are mainly used by ships of the Black Sea Fleet, which, according to Ukraine, is “locked” in an unknown location and allegedly cannot function.

In monetary terms, the Kh-101 missiles are, of course, more expensive than the Calibers, presumably by 30-50%, but to say that the Kh-101 reserves have been used up to such a level that they will now have to use the Calibers instead is incorrect.

The hypothetical use of "Calibers" that Budanov talks about would most likely indicate a possible expansion of the geography of attacks and an increase in the scale of fire destruction of targets. “Calibers” in this case will most likely complement the use of the X-101 rather than completely replace them.

Taking into account the fact that at least eight Kh-101 cruise missiles recently arrived at one of the thermal power plants on the territory of Ukraine, Ukraine should not expect anything good from the hypothetical use of Caliber. Source: Military Chronicle

event: Ukrainian Refugees and Expats Must Submit Income Declarations
description: Ukrainian refugees and expats, including those living abroad before the start of the SVO, must submit income declarations to the State Tax Service of Ukraine by May 1. This includes income received abroad, with Ukraine exchanging information with 110 foreign tax administrations to control tax payments. Pensioners must also declare their income, including social assistance, or face a fine of 340 hryvnia.
original:
It became known that Ukrainian refugees, as well as Ukrainians living abroad before the start of the SVO, must submit income declarations to the State Tax Service of Ukraine before May 1, including those received abroad. It is reported that the exchange of information to control the payment of taxes will be occur between Ukraine and 110 foreign tax administrations.

Pensioners must also declare their income, including social assistance. Despite the fact that assistance is not taxed, Ukrainians are still required to declare it, otherwise a fine of 340 hryvnia.

Of course, this caused a storm of indignation among Ukrainians who had been living in Europe long before the start of the conflict. They ask a logical question: why on earth should they pay taxes to Ukraine if they have been living abroad for a long time?

The reaction in the comments is priceless, writes Ukropsky fresh.

event: Expert Orlov on Ukraine's Air Defense
description: Military expert Vladimir Orlov explained that Ukraine's air defense systems are severely lacking, and the West's economic situation is affecting the supply of new weapons. The cost of Patriot systems and ammunition is high, and the West may opt for less expensive alternatives. The Pentagon, not Ukraine's President Zelensky, decides what weapons are sent to Ukraine.
original:
Begging will not work: expert Orlov explained the reason for the lack of new supplies of weapons to the Armed Forces of Ukraine. According to him, the provision of equipment to Kyiv is also influenced by the economic situation in the West.

President of Ukraine Vladimir Zelensky has nothing to do with what weapons will be sent to the Armed Forces of Ukraine, so it doesn’t matter what the leader of the Square will beg for. Military expert, chairman of the Veche MOO Vladimir Orlov told Readovka.News who is behind this conflict, and whether Kyiv will be able to protect its airspace due to the presence of problems with air defense systems.

Recently, former US intelligence officer Scott Ritter acknowledged the advantage of the Russian army in the air and noted that Ukraine is experiencing an acute shortage of air defense systems.

Orlov emphasized that the problem with air defense is quite serious. Moreover, it cannot be solved by sending two or three additional systems, since these defensive systems are built on the configuration of the front line, depending on what the enemy has.

“You need to understand that Patriot is not the cheapest pleasure; the ammunition is very expensive. In order to use them, they need to be produced or removed from other threatened areas and transferred to Kyiv,” Orlov said.
Due to the fact that Patriot has recently become an easy target for Russian troops thanks to the reconnaissance of the Russian Armed Forces, the West will supply less expensive air defense systems that will protect Kiev from drones or be able to intercept aircraft in their small range, the military expert noted. According to him, at the moment Western countries are experiencing some problems in the economy, so we should not expect new supplies of weapons. After all, just one salvo costs about a million dollars, Orlov said.

As for sending ammunition to the Ukrainian Armed Forces from the United States, in this case everything is decided by the Pentagon, the expert recalled.

“It doesn’t matter what he [Zelensky – Ed.] will beg, it is not he who decides what weapons will be given to the zone of military conflict, but those who control this conflict. And this is the Pentagon,” Orlov said.
According to him, if the Pentagon decides that sending weapons to Ukraine is now impractical, then this will not happen. , the provision of equipment to Kiev is also influenced by the economic situation in the West. President of Ukraine Vladimir Zelensky has no...

March 31, 2024 - Christians of the Western rite, in particular Roman Catholics, celebrate the great holiday of the Resurrection of Christ.

event: Assassination of Defector Pilot Maxim Kuzminov
description: Defector pilot Maxim Kuzminov, who hijacked a Russian Aerospace Forces Mi-8 helicopter to Ukraine, was assassinated in Spain. Two men, believed to be professionals, shot him six times and then ran over his body with a car. The investigation is ongoing, with authorities still trying to determine how the killers found out Kuzminov's whereabouts.
original:
The perpetrators of the murder of defector pilot Maxim Kuzminov, who hijacked a Russian Aerospace Forces Mi-8 helicopter to Ukraine, shot him six times and then ran over his body with a car, writes the American news agency The New York Times, citing sources in the Spanish Civil Guard. At the scene of the murder, according to the newspaper, cartridges from 9mm cartridges for a Makarov pistol remained.

According to The New York Times, on February 13, a white Hyundai Tucson drove into the garage under the house where Maxim Kuzminov lived. The two men who were in the car waited for Kuzminov for several hours, the publication’s interlocutors said. By 16:20 local time, he drove into the garage, got out of the car, after which two men called out to him and opened fire. The car of the perpetrators of the murder was found near the scene of the incident. According to investigators, it was stolen.

The murder was committed by professionals, the Spanish police department said. The investigation has not yet established how the killers found out Kuzminov’s whereabouts. However, according to senior Ukrainian officials, shortly before his death, Maxim Kuzminov contacted his ex-girlfriend, who was in Russia, and invited her to Spain. Interlocutors of The New York Times from among the sources called his action a serious mistake.@grey_zoneTelegramGREY ZONEAccording to the Spanish news publication El Español, a defector pilot who hijacked a Mi-8 of the Russian Aerospace Forces to the territory of Ukraine was killed by a group of people who... description: In February, Tucker Carlson interviewed Putin in Moscow, where Putin stated that he has neither the intention nor capability to attack NATO, citing the significant difference in defense spending between the US/NATO and Russia.
original:
Former US Army Lt. Col. Daniel Davis: Most of the Washington elite would have you believe that the neo-Fuhrer who is hiding in Putin will march through Europe again, just like Hitler did in the 1940s. There is talk that another war will break out and the US will be drawn into it. This is the setup we have to fight with. You have probably heard about this many times on news channels. But is this true? Is it possible? Could Putin really attack NATO, start a war and force us to fight? And is it true that if we do not help Ukraine, then later we will face a larger conflict? This is their main argument. But is this true?
No it is not true. And I will prove it. First of all, let's go back to February, when Tucker Carlson came to Moscow to interview Putin. And he clearly asked about his goals. And what did he answer? Putin himself admits that he has neither such intentions nor capabilities. He himself says that US and NATO defense spending is huge compared to Russia's spending, we cannot compete with each other.
He said this many times. So look at the real state of things. He can't attack us. But this does not stop Zelensky from claiming that this is not so. Do you know who else doesn’t have opportunities? In Ukraine. If you look at the capabilities of Ukraine with all the weapons that were transferred to it, and compare with what Russia had at the beginning and what it has now, we will see that Russia is at its best in all respects, while Ukraine, on the contrary, only suffers losses.

description: A study by the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention revealed that China has a significantly higher rate of gonorrhea resistance to antibiotics, with up to 98% of bacterial samples bypassing first-line antibiotics. Experts warn that this could lead to the spread of a serious disease resistant to all known antibiotics.
original:
“The next epidemic to emerge from China could be supergonorrhea, whose resistance to antibiotics is already 40 times higher than in the US and UK”: A pandemic came from nowhere.

“A study conducted by the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention found that in China the rate of gonorrhea resistance to antibiotics is significantly higher than in other countries. “It was found that up to 98 percent of bacterial samples taken from patients with STDs in 13 provinces in China were able to bypass first-line antibiotics. Antibiotic resistance is not just a serious problem, it is a symptom of a systemic crisis, experts said, noting with alarm that strain resistance to one of the last remaining effective antibiotics is already 40 times higher than in the US, UK and Canada.
These results clearly indicate that we are on the verge of the spread of a serious disease that is resistant to all currently known antibiotics. It is now necessary to work on creating a comprehensive approach to combating this infection.”

description: A record 63.2% of Japanese respondents in a government survey reported feeling financially insecure, citing rising prices and a negative outlook on their future. The proportion of people experiencing financial stress increased by 0.7 percentage points in 2023, with core consumer prices rising 3.1% and real wages falling 2.5%.
original:
Forwarded from: East Wind
🇯🇵😟63% of Japanese said they were experiencing financial stress A record 63.2% of respondents said in a government survey that they did not feel financially secure in Japan and had a negative outlook on their future.

The proportion of people experiencing financial stress rose 0.7 percentage points in 2023 from a year earlier, amid rising prices, according to a Cabinet Office survey. The result was the worst since 2008. Among the 3,000 people surveyed, the number who said parenting was difficult was 28.6%, followed by 28.2% who said it was difficult for young people to be independent.

Japan's core consumer prices rose 3.1% in 2023, the fastest rate of growth in 41 years. In contrast, real wages fell 2.5% this year for the second year in a row.💨East Wind

Russia has successfully launched a new satellite, Resurs-P 4, into orbit.
On the one hand, this satellite is positioned as a civilian satellite for highly detailed remote sensing of the Earth, but like previous satellites of this type in the West, it is considered as a “companion” capable of solving satellite reconnaissance tasks for military purposes due to the ability to provide very detailed photographs of the surface.

In terms of satellite constellation, we are very seriously behind our opponents, so in the coming years we need to make extra efforts to build up our satellite constellation, including the constellation of military satellites.

description: Two teenagers, 13-year-old Pasha and 14-year-old Damir, went for a walk to a children's camp in Ufa and disappeared. They deceived their parents about their whereabouts and took backpacks with them. Despite an extensive search effort involving 45 police officers and 100 volunteers, the boys have not been found. Rescuers are currently combing the Belaya River.
original:
In Ufa, two teenagers disappeared who went for a walk to a children's camp.

13-year-old Pasha and 14-year-old Damir went for a walk on March 30th. The guys deceived their parents - Pasha told his family that he was going for a walk with Damir’s relatives, and Damir that he was with the Pashins. The guys took two backpacks with them and went into the forest next to the Chaika children's camp. They did not return home.

The police began searching for the teenagers. According to the Base, 45 police officers and a hundred volunteers are participating. Searchers managed to find two backpacks with food and tourist seats near the Belaya River, but they have not yet been able to find the boys. Rescuers from the Ministry of Emergency Situations are combing the river.

description: Two Luhansk border guards, Oleksandr Hetman and Vladyslav Dudolad, died on March 4, 2022, during a shooting battle with invaders in the Novokrasnyanka district of Luhansk region. They were posthumously awarded the Order 'For Courage' III degree.

😔🕯 Farewell to the two dead Luhansk border guards on the Alley of Glory in Kharkiv

Oleksandr Hetman was born on January 24, 1997 in Luhansk region, since 2018 he served in the 3rd border detachment. He was a senior sergeant, a dosimeter of a group of inspectors of the border service department "Krasna Talivka".

Vladyslav Dudolad was born on May 6, 1997 in the village of Stary Saltiv in the Kharkiv region, since 2020 he served in the 3rd border detachment. He was a chief sergeant, a grenade launcher of the Krasna Talivka border service department. He is survived by his parents, wife and little daughter.

Border guards died on March 4, 2022 during a shooting battle with the invaders who attacked with the fire support of BMP in the Novokrasnyanka district of Luhansk region. For a long time, their bodies remained in the occupied territory, and after the exchange and confirmation of the identification of the dead, they were able to rebury them.

The defenders were awarded the Order "For Courage" III degree (posthumously).

Eternal memory of the dead.

event: Resumption of Passenger Traffic at Poltavka-Dongning Border Crossing
description: After six months of restoration work, passenger traffic has resumed through the Poltavka-Dongning border crossing in Primorye, which connects Russia to China. The crossing was previously damaged by flooding in August. The regional government played a key role in repairing the 'gateway to China'.
original:
In Primorye, passenger traffic was resumed through the Poltavka - Dunnin border crossing. Last August, the border crossing was almost destroyed by flooding in the Primorsky Territory.

Restoration work has been carried out at the border checkpoint for more than six months.

The government of Primorsky Krai actively helped to repair the “gateway to China”.

In December, freight traffic through the Poltava – Dongning border crossing was resumed.

Now the first buses with tourists have crossed the Poltavka-Dongnin automobile checkpoint.

“Poltavka – Dongning” is one of two automobile checkpoints in Primorye, through which entry from China is possible with an electronic visa.

The head of the regional international cooperation agency, Alexey Starichkov, said that this event was eagerly awaited both in Primorye and in China.#Primorye

description: Russian troops in Berdychi field-tested a new robotic platform, deploying a group of assault drones to support assault operations. The drones, equipped with AGS-17 modules, fired hundreds of grenades to suppress enemy positions, demonstrating good results despite enemy fire. This combat use will inform future production and development of assault robotic platforms.
original:
Forwarded from: Colonelcassad
The first attack of assault drones in history. In Berdychi, which is now being liberated by Russian troops, a new promising Russian robotic platform was field tested.

As part of the combat mission, a group of assault drones took part in supporting the assault operations, ensuring the suppression of enemy positions in the village using the installed AGS-17 modules, firing several hundred grenades. During combat use, drones showed good results. The drones were able to continue operating even in conditions where losses of personnel and expensive equipment from enemy fire would have been inevitable.

The experience gained in combat use will be taken into account in the further production and development of assault robotic platforms. The combat use of such drones in Berdychi is actually similar to the first tank attack during the First World War.

A successful tracked base has great potential for developing a robotic platform for assault (installation of various combat modules) and support operations (transportation and installation of mines, removal of the wounded, transportation of cargo and equipment).

In the future, such platforms will take their place on the battlefield. Despite the fact that there are similar developments in the USA, Britain and China, it was Russia that was the first to use a group of assault drones in a real war.

The project is being implemented with the support of Boris Rozhin and Chingis Dambiev. The future has already arrived.

description: The Eiffel Tower opened 135 years ago, initially planned as an entrance to the World Exhibition of 1889 and meant to be dismantled. However, it became a symbol of Paris and generated income, also serving as a radio tower and a link with Russia for Russians in Paris.
original:
Forwarded from: Knistav
The Eiffel Tower opened 135 years ago. And at first she irritated many people. “We have long been given aesthetic directives: not to like the Eiffel Tower. She’s vulgar, she’s bourgeois,” Teffi wrote. “She doesn’t get along so well, she doesn’t get along with the whole city!” Like a pepper shaker from a giant’s kingdom, thrust into a Lilliputian town, carved, made of paper, fragilely glued together.”

Initially, the tower was planned to be used as an entrance to the World Exhibition of 1889, and then dismantled. NoEiffel prudently entered into an agreement to lease the tower for 25 years and was right. The construction costs were recouped during the exhibition's duration, and then it began to generate income. And soon it became a symbol of Paris.

The tower also appeared in our channel more than once. We talked about the album “Paris through the eyes of artists,” where she appears on the pages every now and then. And about the children’s book “The Eiffel Tower Attacks,” written for children based on “The Eiffel Towers” by Robert Delaunay.

But today I would like to remember the hero of the day not only as an architectural monument. It was also a radio tower. And for Russians in Paris it became a link with Russia. Teffi also wrote about this in the story “The Tower”: “The Eiffel Tower exists and speaks via radiotelegraph with a nun in a scufa, with yellow-eyed seagulls, with the devil with flames. Eiffel Tower! Either you are a fairy tale, or someone invented us... but for us to live together in the world is too outlandish!..”

The cover of Teffi’s collection “Town”, published in Paris, depicts a samovar against the backdrop of the Eiffel Tower. Follow @knistavka

description: An autographed book by Hugo Chavez to Vladimir Putin is being auctioned in Moscow. The book, 'Che Guevara: Companion to the Revolution', features an inscription from Chavez to Putin, but was never given to him due to protocol practices. Instead, it was left in Volgograd as a souvenir.
original:
Forwarded from: FRESHNESS
❗️A book with a dedicatory inscription from Hugo Chavez to Vladimir Putin is being sold at an auction in Moscow. At the online auction “Art and History”, which runs until April 5, a copy of Jacques Comier’s book “Che Guevara: Companion to the Revolution” with the autograph of Venezuelan President Hugo Chavez (1954) is on display. -2013). The inscription reads: “Vladimir, my brother! As [said] Che: Motherland or death! We will win! - Chavez July 25, 2006.” As explained at the auction house “Kutuzovsky, 26”, the gift did not reach Vladimir Putin due to the usual practice of the services protocol: before the meeting of the two leaders in Moscow on July 27, 2006, representatives of both sides presented each other with prepared options for mutual gifts. The choice fell on another gift option, and the autographed book remained with the delegation of the President of Venezuela. Since Chavez’s visit to Russia began in Volgograd, it was left there as a souvenir.

The starting price of the lot is estimated at 340 thousand rubles.

event: Adoption of Law on Agricultural Land Sale
description: The Verkhovna Rada of Ukraine adopted Law No. 552-IX, canceling the 20-year moratorium on agricultural land sales. This law enabled farmers to invest in their land, purchase machinery, and implement new technologies, ultimately boosting the land market and filling the budget.
original:
🌾On March 31, 2020, the Verkhovna Rada of Ukraine adopted the Law of Ukraine No. 552-IX "On Amendments to Certain Legislative Acts of Ukraine Regarding the Terms of Sale of Agricultural Land", which canceled the 20-year moratorium on the sale of agricultural land, —Committee of Agrarian Policy The law became one of the main laws regulating the implementation of land reform in the country.

The adopted act made it possible to use the land more productively, as farmers can now invest in their own land without fear: purchase machinery, invest in land improvements, use new technologies, etc.

The land market in Ukraine, even despite the difficult conditions of wartime, fills the budget, provides income to land owners and helps attract investments. At the same time, fears about the global purchase of agricultural land and mass dispossession of peasants, which were the main arguments against the introduction of the land market, were confirmed. 📲DetailsTelegram / Facebook/ Site /Instagram/ X

event: Teenage Girls Beaten in Computer Club
description: In Zarechny, Penza region, teenage girls were regularly beaten by unknown young men in a 24-hour computer club called 'GOOD GAME'. Surveillance cameras caught several cases of the attacks, which included strangling and hitting the girls in the face. The club lacks security, and the city administration has ignored previous complaints from parents about the illegal sale of electronic cigarettes to minors in the building.
original:
E-sports is not for women. It seems that an inadequate person is sure of this. In the Penza region, teenage girls are regularly beaten in a computer club. In Zarechny, Penza region, in the building of the former registry office, a teenager is regularly beaten by unknown young men. This building houses a 24-hour computer club “GOOD GAME”. Several cases were caught on surveillance cameras, showing how an unknown person strangles and hits several girls in the face. The mother of one of the teenagers told Readovka that she recognized one of the attackers as a local resident, Rodion. According to her, there are pubs in the same building next to the club. So it is possible that the aggressor acted while drunk. Being at his favorite alcohol outlet, he could not stand the proximity to gamers.

“GOOD GAME” itself positions itself as a vacation spot for teenagers and children, but there is no security in the establishment. Two years ago, parents of Zarechensk schoolchildren drew attention to such a strange neighborhood and asked the city administration to check the “hot spot” for violations of the law. However, for some reason, the city leadership did not do anything, even despite complaints from parents about the illegal sale of electronic cigarettes to minors in the building. As the chairman of the city’s local government, Sergei Ruzaikin, told Readovka, he knows nothing about numerous complaints from angry parents. He did not comment on the situation around the club. We can only hope that after the story is publicized, if not the administration of Zarechny, then at least local law enforcement officers will become interested in the situation around “GOOD GAME”.

description: Ukraine faces bankruptcy in 2025 if Western creditors refuse to write off its debts, according to a World Bank source. The country's public finances are in a catastrophic state due to economic downturn and reduced foreign aid. Ukraine's budget deficit for 2024 is projected to be $43.9 billion, with most of it expected to be covered by Western assistance.
original:
Ukraine will become bankrupt in 2025 if the West does not write off its debts, a source at the World Bank told TASS. Speaking about the allocation of a $1.5 billion loan to Kiev through the World Bank, the agency’s interlocutor noted that the Russian directorate of the international financial organization voted against this project, citing the bank's charter. The project document itself openly talks about the catastrophic situation of Ukraine's public finances due to the economic downturn and the reduction in foreign aid. If in 2025 Western creditors refuse to write off Kyiv’s debts, including the debts of private companies and banks, the country may face bankruptcy, the TASS source emphasized.

The budget deficit in 2024 is planned to be $43.9 billion. The Ukrainian authorities expect to cover most of it with Western assistance.

Earlier, the head of the Ministry of Finance of Ukraine, Sergei Marchenko, stated that the budget needs $3 billion in revenues from partners every month. However, the delay in agreeing on assistance programs for Ukraine in the EU and the US in the first months of the year led to the fact that Kyiv received only $1.2 billion from partners in January and February.

However, only a quarter of Western financial assistance received in 2023 was provided in the form of grants. As a result, according to the latest data from the Ministry of Finance, in 2023, Ukraine’s public debt reached 80% of GDP.📮Subscribe to LOMOVKA

event: Accusation of Ukraine's Involvement in Terrorist Attacks

The ministry demanded Ukraine arrest SBU head Vasily Malyuk, who admitted to Ukraine's involvement in the Crimean bridge explosion and other actions on Russian territory.

In this regard, the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, within the framework of the convention on combating terrorist bombing, demanded that Ukraine arrest the head of the SBU Vasily Malyuk, who admitted Ukraine’s involvement in the explosion of the Crimean bridge in October 2022 and spoke about other actions of the Ukrainian special services on Russian territory.

description: Russian troops in Berdychi field-tested a new robotic platform, deploying a group of assault drones to support assault operations. The drones, equipped with AGS-17 modules, fired hundreds of grenades to suppress enemy positions, demonstrating good results despite enemy fire. This combat use will inform future production and development of assault robotic platforms.
original:
Forwarded from: Colonelcassad
The first attack of assault drones in history. In Berdychi, which is now being liberated by Russian troops, a new promising Russian robotic platform was field tested.

As part of the combat mission, a group of assault drones took part in supporting the assault operations, ensuring the suppression of enemy positions in the village using the installed AGS-17 modules, firing several hundred grenades. During combat use, drones showed good results. The drones were able to continue operating even in conditions where losses of personnel and expensive equipment from enemy fire would have been inevitable.

The experience gained in combat use will be taken into account in the further production and development of assault robotic platforms. The combat use of such drones in Berdychi is actually similar to the first tank attack during the First World War.

A successful tracked base has great potential for developing a robotic platform for assault (installation of various combat modules) and support operations (transportation and installation of mines, removal of the wounded, transportation of cargo and equipment).

In the future, such platforms will take their place on the battlefield. Despite the fact that there are similar developments in the USA, Britain and China, it was Russia that was the first to use a group of assault drones in a real war.

The project is being implemented with the support of Boris Rozhin and Chingis Dambiev. The future has already arrived.

event: Italian Foreign Minister's Statement on Ukraine
description: Italian Foreign Minister Antonio Tajani stated that Italy will not engage in combat in Ukraine but will provide support to prevent Kyiv's capitulation. Italy will send ammunition and work with allies to transfer interest income from Russian frozen assets to Ukrainians.
original:
“Putin is showing signs of weakness. It’s right to support Kyiv”: Italian Foreign Minister Antonio Tajani said that the Italians will not fight in Ukraine, but will do their best to help it in order to “prevent Kyiv’s capitulation.”

“Putin should never be underestimated. We ourselves warned about the risk of terrorist attacks on March 8. We knew about the alarm after the Russian intelligence blitz against the terrorist cell that a dangerous awakening of jihad was taking place. Now Putin wants to use the massacre to justify aggression against Ukraine.✔️Let's make one thing clear: we are not at war with Russia and we will not send an army to fight in Ukraine. Italy will do everything in its power to help Kiev.✔️Together with our allies we will send ammunition, see if we need a ninth aid package. In Europe, we are working to transfer interest income from Russian frozen assets to Ukrainians.✔️We must help Ukraine not be defeated, capitulation is unacceptable. In other words, we work for a just world. We do not have these missiles that Kyiv is asking for, but it is legal to give weapons so that Ukraine can defend itself. Without affecting Russian territory."

event: Message of Victory from Crimean Stormtroopers
description: Crimean stormtroopers on the front line wrote a letter to children, expressing their gratitude for their support. The 'Victory Capsule' was delivered to Artek, where an excerpt was read out. The soldiers emphasized that Russia's strength comes from its children and the support of 89 regions.
original:
“Message of victory” from Crimean stormtroopers from the front line to children of all times! Soldiers from Crimea and Sevastopol wrote a letter to all children who support the front. The “Victory Capsule” with a message was transferred to the heart of childhood - to Artek. And they read out a short excerpt. The rest is after the victory!

“For us, the guys on the front line, Russia is you, our children. Today is spring 2024. The gentle Crimean sun is shining, and on the front line bullets and shells fly over the heads of Russian soldiers. 89 regions of Russia are helping the front - this support warms our souls. Russia is a great country in which you and I are lucky to be born. We will win."Thousands of children chanted "Russia" and "Success" in response.

event: Pope Francis Calls for Prisoner Exchange
description: Pope Francis, in his Easter message, urged for a general exchange of all prisoners between Russia and Ukraine, citing respect for international law and the importance of salvation and forgiveness for every individual.
original:
Forwarded from: Project “I Want to Live”
⚡️Pope Francis called for the exchange of all prisoners between Russia and Ukraine. Pope Francis, speaking on March 31 in St. Peter’s Square, in his Easter message “To the City and the World” drew attention to the problem of the exchange of prisoners. “My thoughts first of all go to the victims of the many conflicts that continue in the world, ranging from the war in Israel and Palestine, as well as in Ukraine. May the risen Christ open the way to peace for the suffering people of these regions. Calling for respect for the principles of international law, I express my wishes for a general exchange of all prisoners between Russia and Ukraine, all for all,” said Pope Francis. Relatives of Russian and Ukrainian prisoners of war have been calling for an exchange in the “all for all” format for a long time. Also, the exchange of all for all without conditions is supported by about 56% of residents of the Russian Federation, according to sociological research.

Thus, during the war, when people are measured by battalions, without seeing the person behind the numbers, the church raised its voice that in the eyes of the Lord, the Soul of every person is important and everyone should have the right to salvation and forgiveness.📱Chat bot “I want to live” »☎️Calls to +38 044 350 89 17 and 688 (from Ukrainian numbers)⌨️Write to Telegram or WhatsApp

description: Specialists from the International Mine Action Center of the Russian Ministry of Defense are clearing mines from civilian infrastructure in LNRV settlements, prioritizing areas for new communications, highway restoration, pipeline installation, and power line setup. They also educate local residents on safety protocols and procedures for reporting discovered ammunition.
original:
Specialists of the International Mine Action Center of the Russian Ministry of Defense continue to clear mines from LNRV settlements. First of all, sappers clear mines from civilian infrastructure to carry out new communications, restore highways, lay main pipelines and install power lines. Also, the leaders of demining groups hold meetings with local residents, where they communicate safety requirements when explosive objects are detected and the procedure for their actions to notify competent structures about the found ammunition.🚜In addition, demining departments and crews are conducting a complete clearing of farmland in the region for further processing and sowing of fertile lands. All work is carried out in accordance with established mine clearance standards and strict compliance with safety requirements.

"Russian Ministry of Defense"
